summary: The Coast Guard Investigative Service and Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General have overlapping authorities to investigate certain complaints involving the Coast Guard. The agencies could improve collaboration on Coast Guard complaints. Clarifying roles and responsibilities for referring complaints and establishing regular communication to deconflict investigative activities, for example, could help the agencies prevent duplicative investigations and use resources effectively and appropriately. Our...
title: Coast Guard Oversight: Actions Needed to Strengthen Collaboration on Investigations
